intro: Buhsea trinervia var. ramosa, commonly known as the ramose buckthorn, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, thorny growth and small, elliptical leaves that are often clustered in threes. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in late spring, followed by small, dark berries in the fall. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
